    This defaults to false, but if set to true in a node yaml,
    will automatically set up the rate limiter and configure it in
    httpd, as conf.d/25-rate-limiter.conf as a global setting.

    website content. Motivation and details at: https://s.apache.org/beam-site-automation
    
    Website sources are now hosted at: https://github.com/apache/beam/tree/master/website
    Website generated HTML is now hosted at: https://github.com/apache/beam/tree/asf-site
    Release-based javadocs and pydocs are now hosted at: https://github.com/apache/beam-site/tree/release-docs

commit e80996b75e605d2790901ce6194459d518562c29
Author: Daniel Gruno <humbedooh@apache.org>
Date:   2018-04-30 16:31:39 +0200

    simplify tlpserver config; rewrite paths
    
    We have a terrible mix of:
    - /www/foo
    - /var/www/foo
    - /x1/www/foo
    
    I changed them all to be /www/foo as per pubsub configs, so we don't
    need to maintain 3 locations that are essentially the same.

commit 3694ebc08bfe67c01fced86f6488ef055c5a7082
Author: Greg Stein <gstein@gmail.com>
Date:   2018-04-19 22:53:54 -0500

    Remove some vestiges of svn-based authorization files -- they are
    located in (git-based) infrastructure-puppet nowadays.
    
    * pre-commit-infra: don't look for and verify changes to the authz
        template.
    * post-commit-infra.erb: don't bother attempting to generate the
        authorization files upon a change (to a now-non-existent file)
    * authz-bogus-usernames: no longer used by pre-commit-infra
    * gen_asf-authorization_on_template_commit.pl: no longer used by
        post-commit-infra.erb
    * gen_asf-authorization_on_ldap_change.pl: was never used

0	29	modules/rootbin_asf/files/bin/svn/authz-bogus-usernames
1	33	modules/subversion_server/files/hooks/pre-commit-infra
0	7	modules/subversion_server/files/scripts/authorization/gen_asf-authorization_on_ldap_change.pl
0	7	modules/subversion_server/files/scripts/authorization/gen_asf-authorization_on_template_commit.pl
1	6	modules/subversion_server/templates/post-commit-infra.erb

commit fed79682d97c27f4831b8d3761424dd921e25fb0
Author: Chris Lambertus <cml@apache.org>
Date:   2018-02-08 15:00:19 -0800

    prepare to switch to a centralized mynetworks
    
    This patch gives all mailrelay boxes the same "allow" list (including networks allowed on hermes,) which is a necessary first step in switching the default postfix relayhost to something other than hermes.
    
    The followup step will be to switch postfix over to use:
    
    mynetworks = /etc/postfix/mynetworks
    
    instead of the existing templated IP list.

3	0	data/common.eyaml
11	0	modules/mail_relay/manifests/init.pp
3	1	modules/postfix_asf/manifests/init.pp

commit 547129670f1abc1c15ef759519fa0f6de154cf22
Author: Sam Ruby <rubys@intertwingly.net>
Date:   2017-06-27 12:44:42 -0400

    baby steps: allow secretary to create people in LDAP
    
    See: http://www.openldap.org/doc/admin24/access-control.html#What%20to%20control%20access%20to
    
    "There are two special pseudo attributes entry and children. To read (and hence
    return) a target entry, the subject must have read access to the target's entry
    attribute. To perform a search, the subject must have search access to the
    search base's entry attribute. To add or delete an entry, the subject must have
    write access to the entry's entry attribute AND must have write access to the
    entry's parent's children attribute. To rename an entry, the subject must have
    write access to entry's entry attribute AND have write access to both the old
    parent's and new parent's children attributes."
    
    So note that this will grant the secretary access to delete an entry.  There is
    no intent to make use of this other than for test purposes (creating and
    deleting test people).  In particular, there is no intent to create higher
    level whimsy tooling to delete people, as the common practice is to disable
    people instead.

9	0	modules/ldapserver/templates/slapd.conf.erb

Author: Daniel Gruno <humbedooh@apache.org>

commit f827a83ad29926268c73f29182cae5a8fb6d91a2
Author: Daniel Gruno <humbedooh@apache.org>
Date:   2017-06-05 15:21:50 +0200

    Add a new 'gitmv' replacement for graduating git repos
    
    This is a migration script for git repositories on gitbox,
    git-wip and git.a.o.
    
    When run on git-wip or gitbox, it:
        - Renames the repositories locally
        - Updates git origins
        - Updates mailing list settings
        - Renames the reposiories on GitHub
    
    When run on git.a.o, it:
        - Renames the repository
        - Updates SVN remote if this is a SVN mirror

159	0	modules/gitbox/files/bin/graduate-podling.py

commit cc5f5eccb0fbfa0f7c7bd9231d5d5fcc349804b1
Author: Sam Ruby <rubys@intertwingly.net>
Date:   2017-05-24 09:29:38 -0400

    allow LDAP attribute to be specified in authorization templates
    
    look for ";attr=" within {ldap:} sections, and extract attribute name
    if this string is present; otherwise default to memberUid,member for
    backwards compatibility.
    
    A single example of this new syntax is included in this commit.
    
    The plans are to shortly make use of this to move PMC authorizations to
    an owner attribute.

commit 06fdab6dbc6c9f5d78cb40705c713912c0ab78d8
Author: Chris Lambertus <cml@apache.org>

commit 18cec9a19230804318961bcb599af38ee2511874
Author: Greg Stein <gstein@gmail.com>
Date:   2016-12-11 23:20:52 -0600

    Switch to using sets for fetched users (we'll need set arithmatic
    shortly).
    
    Switch filter from "2fa_enabled" to "all" since the former is not a
    valid filter, per the API docs. It was being ignored, and defaulting
    to "all"
    
    NOTE: this means the "enabled" list in mfa.json is incorrect -- it
    contains all users, not just those with 2FA enabled.

Author: Daniel Gruno <humbedooh@apache.org>
Date:   2016-11-29 19:57:49 +0100

    first stab at converting the MATT grouper tool
    
    This is for managing github teams via ldap, MFA checks and
    the new linked-accounts database on gitbox. Should probably
    be run every hour or so (running more often would likely cause
    us to eventually hit the API rate limit too soon).
    
    Extended from the original MATT to take podlings into consideration
    and extend their teams on GitHub to include the entire IPMC.

commit f76aad5ab67480414c67136120cd9bfd01cb9b56
Author: Sam Ruby <rubys@intertwingly.net>
Date:   2016-07-21 15:50:29 -0400

    rough in group self service proposal
    
    See the following thread for background:
    
    https://lists.apache.org/list.html?infrastructure@apache.org:lte=1M:make%20groups%20self%20service
    
    Details:
    
    1) add owner to list of hudson apps attrs, and grant owners write access to
       hudson apps.  (leaving hudson-admin and pmc-chairs in place for now).
    
    2) add ou=auth permissions, modelled after parent (ou=groups) with the following
       changes: members of the group have write permissions, and pmc-chairs
       are not listed.
    
    3) add owner to list of ou=groups attributes, and grand owners write access
       to groups.  (leaving pmc-chairs in place for now).
    
    4) change db-jdo definition in asf-authorization from an inline list to
       a reference to LDAP.

17	3	modules/ldapserver/templates/slapd.conf.erb
1	1	modules/subversion_server/files/authorization/asf-authorization-template

commit 0e8616ff7b31356a40749c51c8ee0933ff43f823
Author: Sam Ruby <rubys@intertwingly.net>
Date:   2016-07-31 09:04:52 -0400

    convert %(...) => %{...} in vhost custom_fragments
    
    Background: hiera and Apache unfortunately have the same escape sequence for
    interpolating variables in strings.  While there are various workarounds for
    escaping the escape sequence (%%{}{var} and %{literal('%'}}{var} are both
    popular), neither are working for me when trying to do <If> statements.
    
    After more than an hour of trying various alternatives, it seems best to
    avoid the syntax clash altogether.  As this change will need to be deployed
    and the puppet master restarted before it can be used, I'm pushing it
    separately.

5	0	modules/vhosts_whimsy/README.md
2	1	modules/vhosts_whimsy/lib/puppet/parser/functions/preprocess_vhosts.rb

    Background: hiera and Apache unfortunately have the same escape sequence for
    interpolating variables in strings.  While there are various workarounds for
    escaping the escape sequence (%%{}{var} and %{literal('%'}}{var} are both
    popular), neither are working for me when trying to do <If> statements.

    avoid the syntax clash altogether.  As this change will need to be deployed
    and the puppet master restarted before it can be used, I'm pushing it
    separately.

Merge: 4f50b517 f8cbd6f2

commit f8cbd6f246d621cfde99c2f446d9f2c6567187ac
Author: Sam Ruby <rubys@intertwingly.net>
Date:   2016-01-25 13:21:56 -0500

    change ownership of svn from root to whimsysvn
    
    Puppet will only set the ownership of the directory and log; this
    would be sufficient for a new install but at the moment there is
    existing content and an existing root cron job doing updates.
    
    I've done:
    
      chown -R whimsysvn:whimsysvn /srv/svn
    
    ... but if the cronjob kicks off before this puppet update is applied,
    the whimsysvn cronjob may fail due to lacking permissions on files
    created by root

2	2	modules/whimsy_server/manifests/cronjobs.pp
8	0	modules/whimsy_server/manifests/init.pp

commit 54ea89a50e6205e8bfc99a884c36a7e8b679e000
Merge: 2d514d36 0bcddcbe
Author: Geoffrey Corey <coreyg@apache.org>
Date:   2016-01-25 08:42:49 -0800

    Merge branch 'rubys-whimsy_whimsysvn_user' into deployment

commit 0bcddcbe338522cbbfd3e23f3de7c68851456714
Author: Sam Ruby <rubys@intertwingly.net>
Date:   2016-01-24 22:27:37 -0500

    create whimsysvn user
    
    Explanation: currently svn checkouts are owned by root; which is a
    very effective way to prevent updates by the apache user (www-data).
    I'd like to evolve the simple bash cron jobs into more capable scripts,
    and as well to enable updates to be done by scripts run by procmail.
    And I'd like to do both without the security ramifications of having
    user scripts running as root.
    
    This is necessarily a multi-step process as I am going to need to
    configure /home/whimsysvn/.subversion/config and
    /home/whimsysvn/.subversion/servers as well as do a chown -R on
    the relevant directories before switching over the cron jobs.

11	0	modules/whimsy_server/manifests/init.pp

commit a2b7b42078b8916de6a82012453f020ef2693ecc
Author: Geoffrey Corey <coreyg@apache.org>
Date:   2016-01-05 08:58:29 -0800

    delete state.yaml after every run
    
    This file is no longer really used by puppet, and just gets appended
    to after every run, making it larger and also slowing down the time
    it takes for puppet to run. Checked in #puppet on freenode, and it
    is safe to add a delete in puppet for it.

    Author: pctony <tony@pc-tony.com>
    Date:   Wed Aug 12 09:58:04 2015 +0100

        using the postfix mynetworks var
    
    commit aec3adba28261557d3edb9cc6851259aa79e417f
    Author: pctony <tony@pc-tony.com>
    Date:   Wed Aug 12 09:31:31 2015 +0100
    
        The new MX hosts no longer need to relay via nike and athena - as they
        these have been decomissioned from the SMTP servive stack.
    
        All inbound mail now leaves the MX hosts and goes via the spamd stack
        which then handles internal routing. The MX hosts don't understand the
        internal structure (where which email should be delivered).

commit 1209d5ceb3feac2f1782870cecbfda99d9715b37
Author: Geoffrey Corey <coreyg@apache.org>
Date:   2015-01-09 11:39:40 -0800

    Add rootbin_asf to tlp-us-*
    
    Adding rootbin_asf will add the svnwcsub-hook under /root/bin/www
    along with the proper perms to allow the svnwcsub daemon to read
    and execute the hook, thereby allowing the same svnwcsub.conf to
    exist between the fbsd hosts and the new puppetized tlp hosts.
    
    It will also allow direct copying of the file from svn and into
    git without having to worry about paths.

1	0	data/nodes/tlp-us-east.apache.org.yaml
1	0	data/nodes/tlp-us-mid.apache.org.yaml

    Introduce Vagrant+Serverspec based support for writing integration tests

    serverspec tests for a conceptual 'role' in the ASF Puppet infrastructure (e.g.
    "base ubuntu", "base centos", <specific-node>).

1	1	modules/tlp_vhosts/manifests/config.pp

commit 12b79630bf17d213d6d16ad3afe94f55c0b5c0f4
Author: Geoffrey Corey <coreyg@apache.org>
Date:   2014-11-25 13:34:12 -0800

    Change servername for *.incubator.a.o
    
    It appears that SNI on the AWS host isn't working as expected and
    is using the *.apache.org cert for *.incubator.a.o requests.
    Changing the priority for incubator vhost only reverses the problem.
    
    Forcing the incubator vhost ServerName to be incubator.apache.org
    allows *.incubator.apache.org requests to work properly as well as
    *.apache.org requests. The only downside is that incubator.apache.org
    uses the *.incubator.apache.org cert, and therefore on browsers it will
    not be able to supply site identity information.

1	1	modules/tlp_vhosts/manifests/config.pp
1	1	modules/tlp_vhosts/manifests/ssl_vhosts.pp
